page.title: 16BUCKNALL SHOP
page.content:
Mrs Wilkinson closes the shop for half a day on Tuesday and Saturday and is closed all day on Sunday because it is illegal to open on that day. The building is 85 years old because it was built in 1900 along side Century House which is how it gets its name.
Mrs Wilkinson has one delivery from the wholesalers every week.
The Post Office part of the shop deals in stamps, postal orders, letters, parcels, overseas letters, National Insurance Stamps, National Savings Bank, Gift vouchers, Government Stock/Amuneties, National Girobank, Thomas Cook Travellers Cheques, Savings stamps for car licences, water and television. Licences for television, C.B and dogs. Phone accounts, pensions and allowances.
